course_title: Krishna Meets Jesus:  Hindu Christian Interactions on the Indian Subcontinent
course_description: According to tradition, Christian communities have been present and active on the Indian subcontinent since the apostolic age. This course provides an understanding of what may be called a Hindu religious worldview and looks at how different Christian traditions such as the Syrian Orthodox, Roman Catholic, and Protestant have made their home in this religious context. Through the use of specific historical and contemporary examples the course also explores some representative modes of Hindu-Christian interactions, including symbiotic, ambivalent, and conflictual ones. (Race, Ethnicity, and Gender).
